summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Wadsworth Place, in the City of Seattle, from Twenty-fourth Avenue South to Twenty-sixth Avenue South, by constructing therein a sewer, of proper dimensions and material, together with all necessary catch basins, manholes, flush tanks and other appurtenances necessary for the proper sewerage and drainage of said district, in accordance with Resolution No. 533 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
